newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA TO SEAL RAILWAY VENTURES WITH FOREIGNERS.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA TO SEAL RAILWAY VENTURES WITH FOREIGNERS.

text.p: Bulgarian State Railways (BSR) plans to establish three joint ventures with foreign firms by the year-end, the BSR's director general said on Wednesday.
Anguel Dimitrov said the foreign partners would have a 51 percent stake in the proposed ventures with three railway production plants.
The establishment of the joint ventures was delayed as the foreign firms demanded government guarantees that 100 percent of the plants' production should be sold in Bulgaria.
"We gave them such a guarantee," Dimitrov said.
One of the joint ventures is between Italy's Eurofer Ltd and a plant producing sleepers for railway tracks and electric pylons in the Danube river port of Svistov.
"Next week we will deposit the venture's documents for court registration," Dimitrov told a news conference.
By the end of this month the BSR plans to set up another joint venture between Austria's engineering firm VAE Eisenbahnsystems AG and a Sofia plant for railway points.
The third venture will be between Swiss-Swedish firm Asea Brown Boveri ABB and a Sofia railway plant for automatic and telemechanic equipment, he said.
